meanings.definition: The act of portraying someone or something as evil or threatening.
meanings.sent1: The demonization of the character in the movie made the audience fear him.
meanings.sent2: The politician's demonization of his opponent was meant to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The demonization of vegetables by kids is a common tactic to avoid eating them.
meanings.sent4: Her demonization of spiders as monsters kept her from going near them.
meanings.sent5: The demonization of the old house in the neighborhood spread fear among the children.

meanings.definition: The process of making someone or something seem wicked or evil.
meanings.sent1: The demonization of the forest in the story added a sense of danger.
meanings.sent2: The demonization of the character in the play created a sense of suspense.
meanings.sent3: The demonization of homework by students is a common complaint.
meanings.sent4: The demonization of the storm as a monster made everyone stay indoors.
meanings.sent5: The demonization of the stray cat as a demon scared the neighborhood kids.

meanings.definition: To vilify or criticize someone or something harshly.
meanings.sent1: She would often demonize her coworkers to make herself look better.
meanings.sent2: The media tends to demonize certain groups to create sensational stories.
meanings.sent3: He would demonize his alarm clock every morning for waking him up early.
meanings.sent4: The rival company tried to demonize our product to boost their sales.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to demonize each other during debates.
